info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 11:50AM MDT until September 12 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado, including the following county, Garfield.
* WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. A mudslide over Highway 139 south of Douglas Pass is on going or expected to begin shortly. Avoid traveling and recreating through the advisory area.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1149 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly south of Douglas Pass on CO Hwy 139. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Douglas Pass and CO Hwy 139 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Highway 139 is prone to rockslides and mudslides in heavy rain. Stay alert for rocks and debris on roads, and avoid driving on flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
